strata.name: LVSD
strata.description: Percentage of patients with a diagnosis of CAD or history of cardiac surgery who have a current or prior LVEF < 40% who were prescribed beta-blocker therapy

strata.name: priorMI
strata.description: Percentage of patients with a diagnosis of CAD or history of cardiac surgery who have a prior (within the past 3 years) myocardial infarction who were prescribed beta-blocker therapy

strata.name: 4MonthsOfEnd
strata.description: Office visit, Psych visit, or Face to Face Interaction (No ED) within 4 months of the end of the measurement period that leads to a diagnosis of major depression including remission or dysthymia

strata.name: 4&8MonthsAfterStart
strata.description: Office visit, Psych visit, or Face to Face Interaction (No ED) between 4 and 8 months after the start of the measurement period that leads to a diagnosis of major depression including remission or dysthymia

strata.name: 4MonthsOfStart
strata.description: Office visit, Psych visit, or Face to Face Interaction (No ED) within 4 months of the start of the measurement period that leads to a diagnosis of major depression including remission or dysthymia

strata.name: screenedForUse
strata.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older who were screened for tobacco use one or more times within 24 months

strata.name: intervention
strata.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older who were screened for tobacco use and identified as a tobacco user who received tobacco cessation intervention

strata.name: overall
strata.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older who were screened for tobacco use one or more times within 24 months AND who received tobacco cessation intervention if identified as a tobacco user

strata.name: clinicalASCVD
strata.description: Patients aged ≥ 21 years at the beginning of the measurement period with clinical ASCVD diagnosis

strata.name: >21Familial
strata.description: Patients aged ≥ 21 years at the beginning of the measurement period who have ever had a fasting or direct laboratory result of LDL-C ≥ 190 mg/dL or were previously diagnosed with or currently have an active diagnosis of familial or pure hypercholesterolemia

strata.name: between40And75
strata.description: Patients aged 40 to 75 years at the beginning of the measurement period with Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes and with an LDL-C result of 70–189 mg/dL recorded as the highest fasting or direct laboratory test result in the measurement year or during the two years prior to the beginning of the measurement period
